lead_paragraph: Anwar al-Awlaki, the U.S. imam who joined Al Qaeda in Yemen and was killed in a 2011 drone strike, was revealed as a trainer who advised recruits on how to make bombs and carry out suicide attacks.

byline.contributor: Scott Shane reported from Washington, and Benjamin Weiser from New York.
byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and BENJAMIN WEISER

headline.print_headline: Court Papers Detail American’s Work for Al Qaeda
headline.main: Court Papers Reveal Qaeda Operative’s Work as Trainer and Bomb Expert

snippet: Anwar al-Awlaki, the U.S. imam who joined Al Qaeda in Yemen and was killed in a 2011 drone strike, was revealed as a trainer who advised recruits on how to make bombs and carry out suicide attacks.
abstract: Court documents reveal Anwar al-Awlaki, American imam who became leading English-language propagandist for Al Qaeda, was also hands-on trainer who instructed recruits in bomb-making and terrorist tactics; documents form part of trial of Awlaki's former bomb-making student Minh Quang Pham.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
